intro: Callistigma inachabense, commonly known as the narrowleaf sand verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in dry, sandy soils, often in desert or arid environments. The plant features slender, branching stems and small, lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in fine hairs. Its flowers are typically pale blue or violet, arranged in clusters, and bloom during the summer months. Callistigma inachabense is adapted to withstand drought and high temperatures, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
